Namespace AV.FacebookUtils

Provides a set of utilities for using AV with Facebook.
Defined in: av.js.

Namespace Summary
Constructor Attributes Constructor Name and Description
 
AV.FacebookUtils
Provides a set of utilities for using AV with Facebook.

Namespace Detail
AV.FacebookUtils
Provides a set of utilities for using AV with Facebook.
Method Detail
<static> AV.FacebookUtils.init(options)
Initializes AV Facebook integration. Call this function after you have loaded the Facebook Javascript SDK with the same parameters as you would pass to FB.init(). AV.FacebookUtils will invoke FB.init() for you with these arguments.
Parameters:
{Object} options
Facebook options argument as described here: FB.init(). The status flag will be coerced to 'false' because it interferes with AV Facebook integration. Call FB.getLoginStatus() explicitly if this behavior is required by your application.
<static> {Boolean} AV.FacebookUtils.isLinked(user)
Gets whether the user has their account linked to Facebook.
Parameters:
{AV.User} user
User to check for a facebook link. The user must be logged in on this device.
Returns:
{Boolean} true if the user has their account linked to Facebook.
<static> AV.FacebookUtils.link(user, permissions, options)
Links Facebook to an existing PFUser. This method delegates to the Facebook SDK to authenticate the user, and then automatically links the account to the AV.User.
Parameters:
{AV.User} user
User to link to Facebook. This must be the current user.
{String|Object} permissions
The permissions required for Facebook log in. This is a comma-separated string of permissions. Alternatively, supply a Facebook authData object as described in our REST API docs if you want to handle getting facebook auth tokens yourself.
{Object} options
Standard options object with success and error callbacks.
<static> AV.FacebookUtils.logIn(permissions, options)
Logs in a user using Facebook. This method delegates to the Facebook SDK to authenticate the user, and then automatically logs in (or creates, in the case where it is a new user) a AV.User.
Parameters:
{String|Object} permissions
The permissions required for Facebook log in. This is a comma-separated string of permissions. Alternatively, supply a Facebook authData object as described in our REST API docs if you want to handle getting facebook auth tokens yourself.
{Object} options
Standard options object with success and error callbacks.
<static> AV.FacebookUtils.unlink(user, options)
Unlinks the AV.User from a Facebook account.
Parameters:
{AV.User} user
User to unlink from Facebook. This must be the current user.
{Object} options
Standard options object with success and error callbacks.
